privacyTerms.title: Privacy & Terms
privacyTerms.body:
By continuing, you agree to Mailrecap.co's Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.

Summaries are generated using AI and may not always be accurate.

Mailrecap.co does not provide legal, financial, or medical advice.

sections.title: 1) What MailRecap does
sections.content:
MailRecap helps you capture mail you own or are authorized to manage and provides:

• a plain-language Summary,
• Key Details (up to three items, such as Date, Amount, Contact), and
• Next Steps (general informational guidance and common follow-ups).

MailRecap is a document organization and information tool. It is not a law firm and does not provide legal advice.

sections.title: 2) The most important concept: processing vs. storing
sections.content:
Mail can contain personal information and sometimes sensitive information. MailRecap is designed to minimize what is stored.

We process a mail image to extract text (OCR) and generate outputs (Summary, Key Details, Next Steps).

We do not store the original image after processing is complete (see Retention).

We store only what you choose to keep—typically the Summary + up to three Key Details + Next Steps, after applying automated PII-minimization steps intended to reduce common sensitive identifiers.

sections.title: 3) Information we collect and process
sections.content:
A) Content you provide
• Mail images you capture or upload in the app (used for processing).
• Optional labels or notes you add.

B) Information we generate (outputs)
• Extracted text (OCR) derived from the image (used for processing).
• PII-minimized text derived from OCR (used to generate outputs).
• Summary, Key Details, and Next Steps generated from the mail content.
• Organizational metadata (e.g., category tags, timestamps).

Important: Outputs may be inaccurate, incomplete, or misleading. Always verify the original document.

C) Account and subscription data
• Account identifiers (e.g., email, authentication tokens).
• Subscription status and purchase confirmations.
• Payments: Purchases may be processed by the Apple App Store and/or Google Play (as applicable). We do not store full payment card numbers.

D) Device and usage data (minimized)
• Device type, OS version, app version.
• Diagnostics and crash logs.
• Limited feature usage events (to improve reliability and performance).

sections.title: 4) What we store (and what we don’t)
sections.content:
We do not store (by default):
• The original mail image after processing is complete (except brief technical handling in secure queues/caches needed to complete processing).
• Full OCR text long-term.

We store:
• The Summary and Next Steps you save.
• Up to three Key Details you save.
• Minimal metadata required to display and manage your saved items.
• Account identifiers and subscription status.

Important: Saved outputs can still contain personal information if it appears in the source mail and is not detected/removed by automated methods.

sections.title: 5) PII minimization and redaction (not guaranteed)
sections.content: We use automated methods intended to reduce common sensitive content before storing outputs (for example, patterns resembling account numbers, long identifier strings, or barcode/tracking-like sequences). Minimization is not guaranteed and may miss content or remove content you wanted to keep. You are responsible for reviewing saved outputs.

sections.title: 6) How we use information
sections.content:
We use information to:
• Provide OCR, summarization, Key Details extraction, and Next Steps generation.
• Organize saved items and improve usability.
• Maintain security, prevent abuse, troubleshoot issues, and provide support.
• Comply with legal obligations.

sections.title: 7) Service providers and third-party processing (including AI)
sections.content:
We may use service providers for:
• Hosting and infrastructure
• OCR and summarization (including AI services)
• Customer support tools
• Analytics/diagnostics (minimized)

We require service providers to process information only to provide services to MailRecap, subject to their terms and applicable law.

No training on user content: We do not use your mail content (including images, extracted text, or saved outputs) to train public models. We do not permit our service providers to use your content to train their models for their general purposes.

If you want the current list of core service providers used in production, contact us at support@mailrecap.co.

sections.title: 8) Sharing
sections.content:
We do not sell your mail content.

We may share information:
• With service providers described above (to operate the app).
• To comply with law or lawful requests, or to protect rights, safety, and security.
• In connection with a merger, acquisition, or asset sale (with notice where required).

Advertising: MailRecap does not use your mail content for targeted advertising and does not share mail content for cross-context behavioral advertising.

sections.title: 9) Retention
sections.content:
We retain information only as long as necessary for the purposes described above.

Default retention (Version 1.2):
• Mail images: deleted after processing is completed, typically immediately after processing and in any event within 24 hours. Brief retention may occur in secure processing queues/caches needed to complete processing and error recovery.
• Backups: our systems are designed to exclude mail images from backups.
• Extracted text (OCR): used transiently for processing and not stored long-term.
• Saved outputs (Summary + Key Details + Next Steps): retained until you delete them, delete your account, or we must retain limited records for support, security, dispute resolution, or legal compliance.
• Diagnostics logs: retained for up to 90 days.
• Backups of saved outputs/account data: retained on a rolling basis for up to 30 days, then overwritten in the ordinary course.

sections.title: 10) Your choices and controls
sections.content:
Delete saved items: You can delete saved items in the app (where offered).

Delete account: You can request account deletion by contacting support@mailrecap.co (and in-app deletion may be offered).

Export: You can export your summaries and next steps (where offered in the app).

We may need to retain limited information for security, fraud prevention, dispute resolution, or legal compliance.

sections.title: 11) Security
sections.content: We use reasonable administrative, technical, and organizational safeguards designed to protect information, such as encryption in transit and access controls. No system can be guaranteed 100% secure.

sections.title: 12) Children
sections.content: MailRecap is not intended for children under 13 (or under 16 where required by law), and we do not knowingly collect personal information from children.

sections.title: 13) Region-specific notices
sections.content:
United States (general): You can request access, correction, or deletion by contacting support@mailrecap.co. We will verify your request as appropriate.

California: You may have rights to request access, deletion, or correction of certain personal information, and to opt out of “sharing” for cross-context behavioral advertising. MailRecap does not share mail content for that purpose. Submit requests to support@mailrecap.co.

sections.title: 14) Changes to this policy
sections.content: We may update this policy. We will update the effective date and provide additional notice where required.

sections.title: 15) Contact
sections.content:
Questions, support, or privacy requests: support@mailrecap.co

Company: Gamut Creative, LLC
Posted at: mailrecap.co/privacy

sections.title: 1) Agreement to Terms
sections.content: By downloading, accessing, or using MailRecap (the “App” and related services, collectively the “Service”), you agree to these Terms. If you do not agree, do not use the Service.

sections.title: 2) Eligibility
sections.content: You must be at least 18 years old (or the age of majority where you live) to use the Service.

sections.title: 3) What the Service Does
sections.content:
MailRecap helps you capture mail you are authorized to handle and provides:

• a Summary (plain-language),
• Key Details (up to three items such as Date / Amount / Contact),
• Next Steps (general informational guidance and common follow-ups).

sections.title: 4) Informational Use Only (No Professional Advice)
sections.content:
The Service provides general information and educational content to help you understand and organize documents.

No legal advice / no attorney-client relationship: MailRecap is not a law firm and does not provide legal advice. Using the Service does not create an attorney-client relationship.

sections.title: 5) “Next Steps” definition
sections.content: “Next Steps” are general informational suggestions and common follow-ups that people often consider in similar situations. They are not personalized legal advice, do not apply law to your facts, and may not be appropriate for your situation. If you need advice about your specific situation, consult a licensed professional.

sections.title: 6) Authorization to Scan Mail (Required)
sections.content:
You agree you will only scan or upload mail that:
• is addressed to you, or
• you are authorized to manage (e.g., explicit consent, power of attorney, employment role, or similar authority).

You are responsible for ensuring you have the rights/permission to scan and process the mail content you submit.

sections.title: 7) Your Account and Security
sections.content: You are responsible for all activity under your account and for maintaining the confidentiality of login credentials. Notify us promptly of any suspected unauthorized access.

sections.title: 8) User Content and License to Operate the Service
sections.content:
You retain ownership of content you submit (e.g., mail images). You grant MailRecap a limited, non-exclusive license to host, process, transmit, and analyze your content only as necessary to provide the Service (e.g., OCR, automated PII minimization, summarization, Key Details extraction, and Next Steps generation).

You represent that you have the rights and authorization needed to submit the content and allow MailRecap to process it as described.

sections.title: 9) Processing and deletion of images
sections.content: The Service is designed to process images to generate outputs, then delete the original image after processing, typically immediately after processing and in any event within 24 hours, as described in the Privacy Policy.

sections.title: 10) Subscriptions, billing, and App Store / Play Store purchases
sections.content:
If you purchase a subscription or paid features:
• subscriptions (if offered) may renew automatically unless canceled through your App Store/Play Store account settings;
• charges, renewals, cancellations, refunds, and billing disputes for in-app purchases are handled by the App Distributor (Apple/Google) under its policies; and
• we do not store full payment card numbers.

sections.title: 11) Acceptable Use and Prohibited Activities
12) Modifications and Availability
sections.content: We may modify, suspend, or discontinue any part of the Service at any time. We are not obligated to provide updates or continued availability of any feature.

sections.title: 13) Termination
sections.content: We may suspend or terminate your access if we reasonably believe you violated these Terms or used the Service unlawfully. You may stop using the Service at any time.

sections.title: 14) Disclaimers
sections.content:
THE SERVICE IS PROVIDED “AS IS” AND “AS AVAILABLE.” YOUR USE IS AT YOUR SOLE RISK. TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, WE DISCLAIM WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND NON-INFRINGEMENT.

We do not guarantee accuracy or completeness of outputs. You must verify the original document, including dates, deadlines, and obligations.

sections.title: 15) Limitation of Liability
sections.content:
TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, MAILRECAP WILL NOT BE LIABLE FOR INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, OR FOR LOST PROFITS/REVENUE OR LOSS OF DATA.

OUR TOTAL LIABILITY FOR ANY CLAIM WILL NOT EXCEED THE AMOUNT YOU PAID TO US IN THE 12 MONTHS BEFORE THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM (OR $100 IF YOU PAID NOTHING), UNLESS LAW REQUIRES OTHERWISE.

sections.title: 16) Indemnification
sections.content:
You agree to defend and indemnify MailRecap from claims arising out of:
• your misuse of the Service,
• your breach of these Terms, or
• your scanning/uploading mail without authorization.

sections.title: 17) User Data and Backups
sections.content: While we perform routine backups as part of operating the Service, you are responsible for maintaining your own records of any information that matters to you. We are not liable for loss/corruption of data to the extent permitted by law.

sections.title: 18) Electronic Communications and Notices
sections.content:
You consent to receiving communications electronically (in-app, email, or via the Service) and agree those communications satisfy legal writing requirements.

Notices to MailRecap: You agree to send any notices to MailRecap electronically at support@mailrecap.co.

Notices to you: We may send notices to you electronically, including by email or in-app messages, where permitted by law.

sections.title: 19) App Store / Play Store Terms
sections.content:
If you obtained the App from the Apple App Store or Google Play (“App Distributor”):
• the license is limited to use on a device you own/control and subject to the App Distributor’s usage rules;
• the App Distributor has no obligation to provide maintenance/support; and
• the App Distributor is not responsible for claims relating to the App, except as required by law.

Third-party beneficiary (Apple): To the extent applicable, Apple and Apple’s subsidiaries are third-party beneficiaries of these Terms and may enforce these Terms against you.

sections.title: 20) Governing Law
sections.content: These Terms are governed by the laws of the State of Florida, USA, excluding conflict-of-law principles, except that the arbitration agreement below is governed by the Federal Arbitration Act.

sections.title: 21) Dispute Resolution (Arbitration; Class Action Waiver)
sections.content:
Informal resolution first. Before filing a claim, you agree to contact us at support@mailrecap.co and provide a brief description of the dispute and your contact information. We will try to resolve it informally within 30 days.

Binding arbitration. If the dispute is not resolved, you and MailRecap agree to resolve any claim arising out of or relating to the Service or these Terms by binding arbitration, rather than in court, except that either party may bring claims in small claims court if eligible.

Provider and rules. Unless you and we agree otherwise, arbitration will be administered by the American Arbitration Association (AAA) under its applicable rules.

Location / language. Arbitration will take place in Florida unless the parties agree otherwise, and will be conducted in English.

No class actions. You and MailRecap agree that claims will be brought only in an individual capacity and not as a plaintiff or class member in any class, collective, or representative proceeding.

Opt-out (email-only). You may opt out of this arbitration agreement within 30 days of first accepting these Terms by emailing support@mailrecap.co with the subject line “Arbitration Opt-Out.” Your email must include your name, the email used for your account, and a clear statement that you want to opt out of arbitration.

sections.title: 22) Changes to These Terms
sections.content: We may update these Terms. Continued use after changes means you accept the updated Terms.

sections.title: 23) Contact
sections.content: Questions about these Terms: support@mailrecap.co
